The ssl-verify peer command configures an HTTP server to perform SSL verification on HTTP clients.
The undo ssl-verify command disables an HTTP server from performing SSL verification on HTTP clients. The ssl-verify peer command configures an HTTP server to perform SSL verification on HTTP clients. The undo ssl-verify command disables an HTTP server from performing SSL verification on HTTP clients. By default, an HTTP server does not perform SSL verification on HTTP clients.
ExtraInfo: To prevent access of unauthorized HTTP clients, run the ssl-verify-mode command to configure an HTTP server to perform SSL verification on HTTP clients. This configuration enhances security.
